conclusion: Need to understand how shadows change when light source moves.
Light source initially positioned to the left, casting shadows to the right.
Shadow A is cast by the egg.
Shadow B is cast by the apple.
Shadow C is cast by the baseball.
Shadow D is cast by the microphone.
Shadows formed where light rays hit the ground and are blocked by objects.
Position and size of shadows depend on relative positions of objects and light source.
When light source moves right, shadows move left.
Closer object to light source, larger shadow; farther away, smaller shadow.
Egg's shadow will move left and decrease in size.
Apple's shadow will move left and decrease in size.
Baseball's shadow will move left and decrease in size.
Microphone's shadow will move left and decrease in size.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will all move to the left.
Sizes of shadows will all decrease.
Final Answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will all move to the left and their sizes will all decrease.
